Welcome!
We will send all unknown calls to your voicemail unless they leave you a $0.05 NanoDeposit. If an unknown call rings more than once, it means they have left you a NanoDeposit. Answer the call to find out who left you a deposit. If you don't like the call, just hang up before 25 seconds and keep the deposit.
FAQ
What is KarmaCall? 
 
KarmaCall is a phone application that allows you to block annoying spam and telemarketer calls while making money in the process! 
 
How does KarmaCall function? 
We pay you every time you let us block a call for you. 
 
If the phone number that is calling you is not in your contacts list, KarmaCall will require a small nano deposit for that caller to call you. If you answer that call and hang up before 25 seconds, you get to keep the nano deposit. If you answer and the call last longer than 25 seconds, the full nano deposit will be refunded to the caller. If the caller leaves a NanoDeposit and you do not answer, the caller is fully refunded. If the caller does not leave a NanoDeposit, they are sent straight to your voicemail. 
 
How can I stop blocking phone calls? 
 
Click the main menu (upper left hand side). Click the "Stop/Start Blocking" blocking option. Click the "No" option on the message that pops up. Now, when you access the Android Quick Settings menu (just drag your finger from the top of your screen downward), you should no longer see KarmaCall running. 
 
How can I start blocking phone calls again? 
 
Click the main menu (upper left hand side). Click the "Stop/Start Blocking" blocking option. Click the "Yes" option on the message that pops up. Now, when you access the Android Quick Settings menu (just drag your finger from the top of your screen downward), you should see KarmaCall running. 
 
Why are there several permissions to use KarmaCall and what do they mean? 
 
We ask you for 2 permissions: 
 1. Access Contacts 
 2. Make and Manage Phone Calls 
 
In order for our app to successfully block callers, 
we need access to your contact list so we can block or allow the correct calls. We cannot see, change or manage your contacts list at all. Along with contacts, we need to manage phone calls, which gives us the ability to block calls for you. We will not change the way your phone operates in any other way. 
 
Why do I need to provide my phone number? 
 
KarmaCall needs your phone number so we can create a nano account for you. We only ask for your phone number once and do not use or share this information with anyone. Your privacy is extremely valuable and we will keep it that way. If you still have concerns, please read our Privacy Policy or contact us at support@karmacall.com 
 
What is the 6 digit password that was texted to me when I verified my phone number? 
 
This is called a One Time Password (OTP). 
This password is a verification method to make sure you are you. It is very important that you DO NOT SHARE this password with anyone, as it can give someone else access to your account and information. 
Make sure you enter this password and delete it once your phone number has been verified. 
 
Does KarmaCall collect my personal information? 
 
Absolutely not. 
The only information we need is your phone number. We do not need any of your personal information and your privacy is a primary concern for us. If you have any further questions, please read our Privacy Policy or contact us at support@karmacall.com 
 
How can I see my balance? 
 
You can view your balance on the “Wallet” page, which can be accessed by using the main navigation menu. Your balance will be displayed at the top of that page as USD currency. Furthermore, you can click the “WITHDRAW” button and this page will display your balance in USD and nano currencies. 
 
What is nano? 
 
nano is a digital currency based on blockchain technology. It is designed to be fast, scalable and has zero fees! Every account is assigned its own blockchain. To learn more, you can visit 
https://docs.nano.org/what-is-nano/overview 
 
What is a nano account, and what does KarmaCall do with it? 
 
Think of your nano account with KarmaCall as a digital coin purse or a small money bag. You can withdraw and spend small amounts of money with our help. Every time you block a call, We deposit money into your nano account. If an unsolicited caller calls you and you hang up before 25 seconds, the deposit of that caller goes into your nano account. This nano account is associated with your phone number, but you can create external nano accounts if you want to withdraw nano from your KarmaCall account to an external nano account that you own. 
 
What options do I have to withdraw my nano balance? 
 
There are several options to withdraw a nano balance. First, you can enter an external nano account address, and simply withdraw the funds directly to that account. If you do not have an external nano account address, we recommend downloading the Nalli app or Natrium app. You can find these wallet apps and more, in this link. https://nanowallets.guide 
Second, you can withdraw the funds in the form of gift cards. This feature is still being developed and is not expected until November 21st, 2021. If you would like to try this out on your own outside the app, visit https://nanogate.io 
 
How can I add funds to my nano balance? 
 
Currently, we do not have a deposit functionality in the App to allow users to add funds to their KarmaCall nano account. However, we do have a faucet which allows you to receive a small amount of nano to start using immediately for free! 
 
What is a faucet? 
 
A nano faucet is just like a sink faucet, except it dispenses small denominations of digital currency, in our case nano. Our faucet can be used once by each user. This can be done by navigating to the “Wallet” page and clicking the “FAUCET = FREE $$$” button. Using our faucet will give you 0.0001 nano. 
 
How do I use the faucet? 
 
Just simply click our “FAUCET = FREE $$$” button on the “Wallet” page and you will instantly get nano to use for free! 
 
What can I do with the nano I receive from the faucet? 
 
Please visit https://usenano.org to see the different ways you can use your nano. Within the KarmaCall app, the nano you get from our Faucet will allow you to make 5 free outbound calls to receivers who do not have you (the caller) as a contact. This will give you the opportunity to try out more functionalities of KarmaCall. 
 
How can I get into contact with support if I need any assistance? 
 
You can navigate to our “Contact Us” page located on the App’s main navigation menu in the top left hand corner. On this page, you simply click the “SEND EMAIL” button, select the email app you would like to use to send the email, and send. Your feedback is important to us. We want to help with any issues you may be experiencing. Let us know how we can make your experience the best we possibly can! 
 
I am new to the app, where can I find an app demo or tutorial? 
 
A demo of the app (or video tutorial) will be located on the main page of our website starting by November 1st, 2021. 
 
KarmaCall is free. Am I the product? 
 
Yes, you are the product and our mission is to get you paid what you deserve. Currently, you do not get paid for the data you give out every day. Instead, most companies make money by selling your attention to advertisers. We invented a way to force companies to pay you for your time in order to get your attention. 
Our technology will be used to help businesses get in contact with real, honest customers like you. Businesses will pay you in order to keep you on the line or you can just hang up on them right away to collect their deposit! Either way, we want to give you the power to get paid for your data and time. Of course, a fraction of these payments will be kept by KarmaCall so we can continue to improve our technology to create a world in which we can have meaningful communications again! Our mission is to get you paid for your data and to convince other companies that they should be paying you for your data too.
Requesting Permissions To Be Your Cash-Back Spam Blocker Without these permissions, we cannot block calls for you. Are you sure you want to proceed? You can register your phone number for call-blocking functionality in the app later. Sorry, this app does not work for Android 9.
We need permissions to serve as your personal paywall. 
We only use these permissions to allow cash-calls and your friends/family through, while blocking unpaid, unsolicited calls Enable permissions

Licence Copyright Author "KarmaCall" About us
Imagine a future where every unknown phone call comes with a guarantee of IMMEDIATE financial compensation. 
By using this app, you are making that future a reality. Thank you.


We developed this application to fight back against scammers who steal more than $10 Billion
every year from vulnerable people through phone fraud. We will give you power over your most
precious commodity. Your Time.


This app will always be free to use, because everyone that joins us becomes part of the
bigger picture of data revolution. If enough of us refuse to answer calls, the bad actors will notice and you will get paid for your data.


Thank you for being part of the revolution.


Help us with brutally honest feedback and bug reports.


Sincerely,

AEG, DRJ, VJ, JC, PJG, CR.
Our Commitment
Our mission is to create a market which financially rewards all its participants and is strengthened by numbers. Through KarmaCall, your data becomes a commodity which you have the power to sell or keep to yourself. We believe the future of great businesses is in shared prosperity and that requires that you are financially compensated for your data and time. 

We stand by the new European Union policy, giving our clients and users a greater say in what happens with their data.
What is GDPR?
The GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation) went into effect on May 25, 2018 in the European Union. The GDPR applies to every company that processes EU citizens’ PII (Personally Identifiable Information). This new law prioritizes the importance of the protection and privacy of your personal information in several key areas. The state of California recently passed the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA). All the rights of CCPA are met by complying with the GDPR which KarmaCall does, as described below. 

First, KarmaCall provides the ability to consent to data collection in an easily accessible format. At KarmaCall, we store your personal contact information – phone number, digital wallet, as well as data concerned with our performance of contract which in part captures digital wallet transactions for anti-spam purposes and length of your call times for improving our services. Along with your basic contact information, we use Flurry Analytics to track how you use our application so we can learn how to improve it to make your experience as enjoyable as possible. Any other data which is VOLUNTARILY provided by you (demographics and psychographics), but is not required for our spam-blocking features, will be stored as well. 

Second, KarmaCall supplies the opportunity to request your data. We display the data currently held under your user and/or business entity in a user-friendly format. KarmaCall does not sell or provide your data to any 3rd party sources for any reason. 

Third, KarmaCall presents the option to have all data we have collected, deleted on request. If you make this request, we will comply without undue delay except as required by other laws. For example, some financial data may not be deleted if it is required for tax records. 

For more information, an overview of the EU GDPR regulations can be found here.
